channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Butchered jobs and inflation data add fuel to the fire of uncertainty already blazing in the markets
item.description: A worldwide selloff accelerates as patchy U.S. data clouds the Fed’s next move, sending Wall Street tumbling and volatility surging into the end of th...

item.title: Term Sheet Next: Erica Wenger on elephants, branding in VC, and her first fund
item.description: In our latest Term Sheet Next, Erica Wenger’s Park Rangers Capital has raised its debut $4.3 million fund.

item.title: Your electric bill has replaced the price at the pump as the hot-button, political bellwether
item.description: Residential electricity prices have skyrocketed almost 30% in four years with the AI boom expected to further pressure costs.

item.title: A Major New Experiment in Voting, and the World’s Most Polluted Air
Zelensky Ousted a Heavyweight Mayor. Was It a Power Grab?
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky removed Odesa’s mayor, raising fears he might be using his wartime powers to tighten control over opposition-run cities.

item.title: Zelensky’s Image Is Stained as Corruption Inquiry Shakes His Inner Circle
item.description: The revelations are a remarkable reversal for the Ukrainian president, who once presented himself as a leader who would clean up the country’s politic...

item.title: Ex-Meta exec says Mark Zuckerberg taught him a lesson in work-life balance: Now he has strict rules for meetings and emails at his $1 billion tax firm
item.description: After years at Meta, Martin Ott learned from Mark Zuckerberg that working smarter beats working longer: “It is making sure that you’re not about 24/7 ...

item.title: Conservative Media Picks an Epstein Story Line and Sticks to It
item.description: Right-wing outlets have focused on a single redacted name in the 23,000 pages of correspondence related to Jeffrey Epstein that were released on Wedne...

item.title: In the age of AI, CEOs quietly signal that layoffs are a badge of honor
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Kenya’s Key Export Used to Be Coffee. Now It’s Cheap Labor.
item.description: There’s big money in sending poor workers abroad. Here’s how the economics work.

item.title: Zelensky Ousted a Heavyweight Mayor. Was It a Power Grab?
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky removed Odesa’s mayor, raising fears he might be using his wartime powers to tighten control over opposition-run cities.
